string-array.name: options_rb_2
string-array.item: Roads and tracks for vehicles regardless of their inclination. Regular floor stairs. Beaches of sand or gravel.

Roads with different pavements but that maintain the regularity of the floor, do not have very high steps, and allow to choose the length of the step. Land suitable for horses. Cross country through uniform terrains such as moors, taiga and meadows not very inclined.
March through paths with tiers or irregular steps of different size, height, roughness and inclination. Off-trail walking on uneven terrain. Chaos crosses of stones. March for unstable stones.
Stretches with steps that require the use of the hands until the I Sup.

Climbing steps II to III + of the UIAA scale. Existence of artificial elements for the progression by traction (pins, chains ...). The existence of these steps requires an explicit mention in the section Specific technical difficulties even in the case that the section (and therefore the excursion) were valued 4.

string-array.name: options_rb_1
string-array.item: Main roads well delimited or marked with clear crosses with explicit or implicit indication. Staying on the road does not require effort to identify the trace. Eventually follow a line marked by an unmistakable geographical feature (a beach, the shore of a lake ...

There is a clear path on the ground or signs for continuity. Attention is required for the continuity and the crossing of other traces but without the need for an accurate interpretation of the geographical features. This score would apply to most marked trails that use different types of roads in the same route with numerous crossings: tracks, bridleways, paths, signal-to-signal field (well-placed and maintained).

Although the itinerary is developed by traces of path, lines marked by geographical features (rivers, valleys, cornices, ridges ...) or other people's waymarks, the choice of the appropriate itinerary depends on the recognition of the geographical features and the cardinal points.
There is no trace on the terrain or security to have reference points on the horizon. The itinerary depends on the understanding of the terrain and the route tracing.
The routes and / or natural lines of the itinerary are interrupted by obstacles that have to be bordered.
